intro: Scleromitrion approximatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf spurge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its milky sap and diverse morphological features. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the spurge family. The plant's botanical features reflect its adaptation to arid environments and its role in local ecosystems.
